_meanings:
<ab>N.</ab> of a king of bears
who was of signal service to Rāma
at the siege of Laṅkā. He was
also noted for his medical skill.
[This same Jāmbavat appears to have
lived up to the time of Kṛṣṇa, or
perhaps he was another being of that
time; for there was a fight between
Kṛṣṇa and Jāmbavat for the  
{%Syamantaka%} jewel which the latter had got
from Prasena, brother of Satrājit.
Kṛṣṇa vanquished Jāmbavat, who
placed the jewel, along with his 
daughter Jāmbavatī, at his entire 
disposal].
